intro: Pelargonium fothergillianum, commonly known as the Fothergill geranium, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It features upright, branching stems covered in velvety, dark green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
